column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Hilale (Morocco) (spoke in French): First of all,\r
#Text=my delegation would like to thank France for organizing\r
#Text=this open debate during its presidency of the Security\r
#Text=Council, on an issue that is of the utmost importance to\r
#Text=Morocco - women and peace and security.
#Text=The historic adoption of resolution 1325 (2000)\r
#Text=represented international recognition of the role\r
#Text=played by women in peace and security, not only as\r
#Text=victims but also as agents of change and essential\r
#Text=players in restoring, maintaining and consolidating\r
#Text=peace.
#Text=Maintaining peace and security requires the\r
#Text=integration of the gender perspective into all peace\r
#Text=efforts, in accordance with the provisions of resolution\r
#Text=1325 (2000) and the other resolutions that followed in\r
#Text=that regard.
#Text=Women's participation in negotiation processes\r
#Text=increases the chances of settling conflicts and\r
#Text=sustaining peace.
#Text=That finding was confirmed by a UN-\r
#Text=Women-led global study in 2015, which revealed that\r
#Text=the presence of women in peace negotiations promoted\r
#Text=the sustainability of peace agreements, and that 35 per\r
#Text=cent of agreements negotiated by women lasted more\r
#Text=than 15 years.
#Text=That means that the presence ofwomen in\r
#Text=peace negotiations is a great help for the sustainability\r
#Text=ofpeace agreements.
#Text=On 7 September, 2016, Morocco organized an\r
#Text=international conference on the topic of women and\r
#Text=peace and security.
#Text=It contributed to the international\r
#Text=debate on the role of women in peace processes and\r
#Text=the implementation of national plans of action to\r
#Text=promote collective action on implementing resolution\r
#Text=It was an occasion to reaffirm the\r
#Text=international community's consensus on the need to\r
#Text=strengthen women's participation in negotiations and\r
#Text=agreements concerning the settlement of conflicts and\r
#Text=peacebuilding, as well as to renew the United Nations\r
#Text=commitment to the issue of the inclusion of women\r
#Text=and gender equality in all peacebuilding and conflict-\r
#Text=prevention strategies.
#Text=During the conference, debates focused on\r
#Text=three areas: the role of women in mediation and\r
#Text=conflict-prevention processes, the role of women in\r
#Text=deradicalization and the lessons learned and best\r
#Text=practices in the prevention of sexual violence in\r
#Text=conflict.
#Text=At the conference, my country announced the\r
#Text=creation in Rabat of an independent regional centre, a\r
#Text=think-tank, dedicated to studying the role of women in\r
#Text=peacekeeping operations and their contribution to the\r
#Text=achievement of sustainable development.
#Text=The centre\r
#Text=could serve as a space for reflection, a think-tank and\r
#Text=a source of independent thought regarding the role and\r
#Text=place of women in peacekeeping and peacebuilding\r
#Text=operations in conflict zones.
#Text=It is in keeping with the\r
#Text=priorities ofthe Security Council in promoting women's\r
#Text=empowerment and gender equality in the establishment\r
#Text=of peace and international security, the dissemination\r
#Text=of the culture of peace, ensuring access to justice and\r
#Text=the protection of civil rights.
#Text=Women and girls have special needs in the post-\r
#Text=conflict period, such as health services, livelihood,\r
#Text=land rights and property rights and employment.
#Text=They must also participate in decision-making and\r
#Text=the development of national strategies for post-\r
#Text=conflict economic recovery.
#Text=Unfortunately, women\r
#Text=are often underrepresented in the decision-making\r
#Text=process associated with economic recovery and public\r
#Text=governance in the post-conflict phase.
#Text=They are\r
#Text=not included in formal decision-making structures,\r
#Text=including key economic sectors, such as infrastructure,\r
#Text=extractive industries and commercial agriculture.
#Text=To that end, the preparation of an approach based on\r
#Text=gender and development in a post-conflict context is\r
#Text=imperative in order to ensure that, from the beginning\r
#Text=of the reconstruction process, there is sustainable\r
#Text=and equitable development where both women and\r
#Text=men share resources, opportunities, decision-making\r
#Text=and power.
#Text=In that context, the Kingdom of Morocco takes\r
#Text=this opportunity to commend the work of UN-Women\r
#Text=to promote the implementation of the Security\r
#Text=Council resolutions on women and peace and security,\r
#Text=particularly with regard to economic recovery and\r
#Text=reconstruction through the three areas of intervention:\r
#Text=post-conflict planning, economic recovery and\r
#Text=governance restoration.
#Text=The 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development\r
#Text=has placed great emphasis on peace, including the\r
#Text=prevention of conflict and the elimination of its root\r
#Text=causes through Sustainable Development Goal 16,\r
#Text=which seeks to promote peaceful and inclusive societies\r
#Text=for sustainable development, provide access to justice\r
#Text=for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive\r
#Text=institutions at all levels.
#Text=The universal 2030 Agenda, which advocates a\r
#Text=cross-cutting incorporation of gender in all Sustainable\r
#Text=Development Goals, emphasizes the need to redouble\r
#Text=efforts to prevent conflict and help countries emerging\r
#Text=from conflict, while ensuring that women are involved\r
#Text=in peacekeeping and reconstruction.
#Text=In that sense,\r
#Text=the Goals demonstrate that gender, peace, security\r
#Text=and development are interconnected, interrelated and\r
#Text=inseparable from one another.
